notes: v0.8: Added influence object with mode 'radius' vs 'road_distance'. Wiki overrides applied for Marketplace, Fire Station, Police Station, Radio Tower; Town Hall set to radius requiresRoad=false.
v0.9: Completed road-distance influence breakdown (full/max where available, road-type specific). Added irrigation mode for Water Pump. Updated power plant ranges to include max-with-buffs per wiki.
v1.0: Verified and normalized all road-distance influence values using individual Anno 1800 Wiki pages; removed remaining assumptions and generic fallbacks.
v1.2: Added Old World resident tiers (Artisans/Engineers/Investors) and Scholars (Land of Lions), with needs split into services/core/luxury and impacts sourced from the Wiki Needs tables.
Added New World residents: Jornaleros, Obreros, Artistas with wiki-sourced needs and impacts; wiki is authoritative.
v1.5: System pass (heuristic DLC tagging, need satisfaction rules, explicit service need links via providesNeeds).

changes: Added Hacienda Jornalero/Obrera/Artista Quarters residents variants from calculator params residenceBuildings
Needs derived from calculator params; categories inherited from base tiers where possible
Wiki-impact pass for Hacienda quarters (Jornalero/Obrera/Artista): consumptionPer1000 + influx/happiness/incomePerMin sourced from Wiki Needs tables.
Normalized Hacienda-specific needs to use wiki values (incl. mail, Beach/Cinema/Samba School, Hot Sauce, Atole, Glasses, Electricity).

changelog: v1.4.2: recategorised lifestyle goods (e.g., jewelry, scooter) from coreGoods to lifestyleGoods for consistency.

changes: Added guildhouse/town hall/harbourmaster items & specialists core from Anno Toolkit assets (guildhouseitem/townhallitem/harborofficeitem).
Added item effect vocabulary and explicit item targets mapped to canonical building ids via effect target pools.

notes: Mapped items.dlcDependency numeric IDs to canonical dlcsRequired ids using modding community DLC ID mapping.
